title: Amiodarone Hydrochloride
overview: Amiodarone Hydrochloride is a white to slightly yellow crystalline powder, classified as a class III antiarrhythmic agent. It is widely used in the treatment and prevention of various types of serious cardiac arrhythmias, particularly ventricular and supraventricular arrhythmias. This active pharmaceutical ingredient (API) exhibits low solubility in water but is soluble in alcohol and chloroform. Amiodarone Hydrochloride is valued for its broad-spectrum antiarrhythmic action, prolonging myocardial cell-action potential duration and refractory period, thus stabilizing cardiac rhythm effectively.

specifications.value: White to slightly yellow crystalline powder

features: Highly effective in managing life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias
Proven efficacy in both acute and chronic arrhythmia management
Good chemical stability under recommended storage conditions
Compatible with various excipients and formulation processes
Available in multiple grades and particle size distributions to suit different formulation needs

applications.title: Pharmaceutical
applications.description: Primarily used as an active pharmaceutical ingredient in the formulation of tablets, injections, and intravenous infusions for the treatment of ventricular tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, and other serious rhythm disorders
